review: We spent the first night of owning this little gadget by geeking out- watching 3 seasons of "The Guild" streaming from YouTube.It really is just plug and play, no issues at all setting it up. I love that we'll be able to watch home movies on this just by playing from the I Pad. There are also TONS of gorgeous photos that will run on your screen as a rotating screensaver- if you have a flat screen that's wall-mounted, it's like having your own changing painting on the wall.A great little accessory for the tech lover in your house!

review: Had an old Roku device, which was OK, but much out of date on resolution etc., and had only a component connection, not HDMI.Was really attracted to the concept of using a smartphone or tablet as a remote control, and the price, but now I know why is was priced so low.I tried using an iPhone, android, and iPad as the controller, and all were the same;  often froze up, took forever to pause, start, etc.  Was sort of like "push pause, now count to ten and cross your fingers.  Almost impossible to rewind or fast-forward with any degree of controlStreaming was even worse.  Would take minutes to load a movie, and then would pause to re-buffer several times during a one hour show.  The pauses could be a minute or minutes (not real good for plot continuity).  Would mysteriously hold "26%" loading, then suddenly jump to 100%, only to stall again.  I checked signal strength and bandwidth from my router (at top of the line NetGear), and both were good.My best guess is than the unit was not created with enough on-board memory for effective streaming.I'm going back to Roku!"
author: Amazon Customer

review: I figured, "for 35 bucks how could I go wrong?".I'd been using a 10 ft HDMI cable to connect my laptop to my TV set. While it worked okay, I was always afraid of tripping over the cable so I figured I'd give the Google Chromecast a try. I also liked the idea that I'd be able to stream from my Android phone.At first I just used it to stream Netflix, but more apps were added, including HBOGo. I was able to catch up on several series streaming them from my phone.I give it an A+ for convenience and picture quality.
author: Leland Williamson

review: The chrome cast is great for Netflix and YouTube streaming. I love using my cell phone as a remote for the TV. However, because I am using my TV as a primarily Gaming TV, the Chrome cast may be made obsolete by a PS4. But for the price and the convenience of using any android device as a remote, it is worth the purchase.If you are considering a media player for a family/living room, and not a personal gaming TV as in my case, I would recommend a more fully featured product such as a Roku.
author: Jesse

review: Great value for the price. Works as expected. It's slightly inconvenient that it needs a power connection, but a free USB port on the TV is enough.
